document.docAuthor: Sun, Xin, Bedos, Anne & Deharveng, Louis
document.docTitle: Thalassaphorura microspinata Sun & Bedos & Deharveng 2017, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of the genus Thalassaphorura Bagnall, 1949 (Collembola: Onychiuridae) from South China, with an updated key to world species of the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of the genus Thalassaphorura Bagnall, 1949 (Collembola: Onychiuridae) from South China, with an updated key to world species of the genus

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 1 – 7. Thalassaphorura microspinata sp. nov. 1, dorsal side of body; 2, PAO; 3, labium; 4, labrum; 5, antenna; 6, clubs, and papillae of AIIIO; 7, ventral side of Abd. II – IV. Scales: 0.1 mm (1, 5, 7), 0.01 mm (2 – 4, 6).
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 8 – 13. Thalassaphorura microspinata sp. nov. 8, ventral side of head; 9, tibiotarsus of leg I; 10, anal valves; 11, distal part of leg III; 12, central part of abdominal sternum IV; 13, AS. Scales: 0.1 mm (8), 0.01 mm (9 – 13).

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Pso formula as 32/133/33343 dorsally and 11/000/01110 ventrally, two pso on each subcoxae 1, five guard papillae on AIIIO , 4+4 p-chaetae between inner posterior pso on head, 5+5 (rarely 4+5) chaetae on Th. I tergum, unguiculus without basal lamella and the unguiculus/unguis ratio is 0.4, Th. I–III sterna with 0+0, 1+1, 1+1 chaetae, AS set on small papillae and the AS /unguis ratio is 0.2, and small body size.

materialsCitation.collectorName: Louis Deharveng & Anne Bedos & Type & Changchun

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type material.
Holotype female and 9 paratypes on slides ( 4 females and 5 males ). China : Guangxi : Huanjiang : near Xia Lan Dong ,
2 November 2009
, leaf litter fallen through the entrance of a small subvertical cave, berlese extraction after sifting, Louis Deharveng & Anne Bedos leg. (sample CHIgx09-052).
Type
specimens ( holotype , 2 female paratypes and 3 males paratypes ) are deposited in CAS-IGA, Changchun , and 2 females and 2 males paratypes in MNHN , Paris.

subSubSection.paragraph: Other material. Ibidem, numerous specimens in alcohol.

Description. Holotype length 0.82 mm , length of paratypes : 0.73–0.83 mm in females and 0.64–0.73 mm in males. Shape of body cylindrical, Abd. III–IV parallel ( Figs 1 & 7 ). Color in alcohol white. AS set on small papillae, and the AS /unguis ratio is 0.2 ( Figs 1 & 13 ).

Granulation fine and homogenous, without coarse granules even around dorsal pseudocelli, on dorsal part of antennae, and on Th. I–III. Antennae almost as long as head. Ant. I with 9 chaetae, Ant. II with 13 chaetae. AIIIO consisting of five guard chaetae, five papillae, two smooth sensory rods, and two smooth and spherical sense clubs ( Figs 5 & 6 ), ventro-lateral ms present. Ant. IV with subapical organite, without differentiated S-chaetae; basolateral ms above the second proximal row of chaetae ( Fig. 5 ).

Thalassaphorura microspinata
sp. nov.
1, dorsal side of body; 2, PAO; 3, labium; 4, labrum; 5, antenna; 6, clubs, and papillae of AIIIO; 7, ventral side of Abd. II–IV. Scales: 0.1 mm (1, 5, 7), 0.01 mm (2–4, 6).

FIGURES 8–13.
Thalassaphorura microspinata
sp. nov.
8, ventral side of head; 9, tibiotarsus of leg I; 10, anal valves; 11, distal part of leg III; 12, central part of abdominal sternum IV; 13, AS. Scales: 0.1 mm (8), 0.01 mm (9–13).

TABLE 1. Differential diagnosis of
Thalassaphorura
species with dorsal pso formula as 32/133/33343.

tr.th: Number of pso on subcoxae 1 of legs I, II, III
Number of p- chaetae between inner posterior pso on head
Number of anterior chaetae on ventral tube
Number of chaetae on subcoxae 1 of leg I

tr.td: unguiculus reduced to small blunt process

Number of chaetae on Th. I sternum

tr.td: Great Britain, Scotland: Dalmeny Estate shore; France: Pas-de-Calais: Wimereux

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. Species is named for its short anal spines.

Distribution and ecology. Only known from the type locality. The species was present in leaf litter accumulated at the base of a cave entrance, but not found inside the cave itself nor in the nearby large cave Xia Lan Dong.
